instructions:
The following questions pertain to an experiment in which a fair coin is flipped three times. Define the following three events:

  • A: The first two flips come up heads.
  • B: The last two flips come up heads.
  • C: The last two flips come up tails.

Enter your answer as a simplified fraction. Ex: If your answer is 2/4, then enter: 1/2
question: What is the probability that the first two flips are heads or the last two flips are heads. (What is p(A ∪ B)?)
explanation:
Answer

3/8

p(A) = 1/4, p(B) = 1/4, and p(A ∩ B) = 1/8.

Therefore, P(A ∪ B) = 1/4 + 1/4 - 1/8 = 3/8.
